summary: This bill, the Protecting America's Property Rights Act, aims to establish additional requirements for the purchase and sale of conventional mortgages by financial enterprises. It mandates specific risk management practices related to liens, encumbrances, and title defects, including the use of third-party products regulated by state authorities. The bill also introduces capital standards requiring enterprises to hold an additional 1% of the unpaid principal balance for mortgages not meeting the specified requirements.
